loadout.name: Xenomorph - 
loadout.notes: This build is the ultimate #endgame #pve support build, giving the fireteam unlimited heavy without the need for finishers. It also gives the user special ammo, and with the right mods, both the user and the ally can get both ammo types. Will probably be used with div for #overload and crit damage, but might have a use in a #stasis build too.

loadout.name: Hive, bring a ... boomer?  - 
loadout.notes:
This seems like a very fun build in #casual #pve. You get a crazy number of #arc jolts, blinds, and orbs, since your special weapon acts as both a gun and a grenade. 
Special weapon kills can: 
- Give you or allies an overshield
- Blind nearby targets
- Create 2 orbs
- Jolt nearby targets
- Create an ionic trace

loadout.name:  - Felwinter's Helm - 
loadout.notes: This #neutral build is good with melees that can kill in #endgame #pve, but would probably be good with #void when using finishers or with #strand grapple melee being so strong.

loadout.name:  - Chromatic Fire - 
loadout.notes: I think this will be strongest with #void (weaken), #arc (blind), or #stasis (slow), but it's technically a #neutral #pve exotic, mostly for #casual content. Outbreak might be a strong pair on #void, since the nanites will deal damage to weakened targets, but making an #arc blind build could be strong too.

loadout.name: Graviton Forfeit - 
loadout.notes: #void build for solo invis requirements in #endgame #pve. Should be able to get infinite invis, but might need to add mods to reduce class ability cooldown

loadout.name: Sixth Coyote - 
loadout.notes:
This looks like a fun #strand build for #casual #pve. It also could be a potential invis replacement since enemy agro towards the decoy was increased. 
Tangle Loop:
1. Kill enemy with melee to create an orb and get unraveling rounds. 
2. Pickup an orb for woven mail
3. Kill enemies to create a tangle. 
4. Throw the tangle to unravel and kill enemies. 
We can also dodge to create a decoy, as well as gain health and woven mail with an orb nearby.

loadout.name: Wormhusk - 
loadout.notes: #endgame #pve #strand

loadout.name: Weavewalker - 
loadout.notes: This #strand #endgame #pve build probably needs some adjusting, but

loadout.name: Gyrfalcon's Hauberk - 
loadout.notes: The loop between invisibility, volatile, and a damage boost is amazing with #void weapons and allows nightstalker to have a role in #endgame #pve outside of invisibility.

loadout.name: Secant Filaments - 
loadout.notes: Secant filaments work on #neutral subclasses to make #overload rounds, but this loadout was made for a #void subclass. Getting devour to proc in #endgame #pve is somewhat difficult, so this gets the ball rolling, allowing grenades to be used for debuffs instead of kills. Collective obligation allows you to stun #barrier champions with volatile rounds more consistently than you otherwise would on a #void subclass.

loadout.name:  - Threadlings - 
loadout.notes: I'm really hoping to find some more ways to suspend/sever for this build, but so far this is the only exotic built for #strand. Threadlings are so weak in #pve that it doesn't feel worth using.

loadout.name:  - Aeons - 
loadout.notes: #stasis, could easily be changed to #neutral with some mod changes. Mostly for #endgame #pve content since ammo is important in gms.

loadout.name: A DPS Loadout - 
loadout.notes:
So I've seen posts of this #pve #dps loadout making its way up the chain, and it seems to be effective. The #strand super does pretty good damage and thread of ascent with thread of generation acts as demolitionist, allowing you to have auto-loading too. 
Order is: 

loadout.name: Necrotic Grips - 
loadout.notes: This is technically a #neutral build, but is currently an incredibly strong #endgame #pve loadout (and absolutely destroys #casual #pve) with #strand suspend.

loadout.name: Stag PvE - 
loadout.notes:
I think, interestingly, this #stasis build has some offensive capabilities in #endgame #pve. Normally, stag is used defensively, but with a push for orb generation and rift/grenade uptime, we can have crazy damage resistance up almost all the time. 
 - Rifts give resist, freeze targets, generate shards, and pickup orbs
 - Stasis shards give an overshield and armor charges, which we can turn into an overshield
 - Frozen targets give resist
 - Orbs give health
 - Destroying frozen targets gives class and grenade ability, and freezes more targets

loadout.name: Eye of Another World - 
loadout.notes: Eye of Another World should help with the #strand cooldown increases. Should be a good #endgame #pve build, since it doesn't rely on kills to get cooldown reductions. Lots of suspension with tangles and grenades, which should have at most a 60s cooldown, but will likely be ~40s

loadout.name:  - Frostees - 
loadout.notes: created as #stasis, but could be made #neutral if needed

loadout.name: Assassin's Cowl - 
loadout.notes: A very #neutral #endgame #pve build, giving access to health regeneration and invisibility for subclasses that would not otherwise have them. Probably best on #solar, #arc, or #stasis.

loadout.name: Renewal Grasps - 
loadout.notes: A decent #stasis build for #endgame #pve. This should provide a TON of survivability. You get damage resistance from being inside a duskfield, as well as from being near enemies. You also get an overshield from defeating slowed enemies, which will happen in the duskfield.

loadout.name: Starfire Protocol - 
loadout.notes: Since starfire's nerf, this #solar #pve build is probably better for ad clear than dps. Health on grenade kills makes this viable in #endgame #pve, but I think pushing this to make use of grenade kills will make it viable after the nerf.

loadout.name: Vesper of Radius - 
loadout.notes: This #arc #pve build has potential in #casual content, allowing for high uptime on healing for a class that generally struggles to heal.

loadout.name: Severance Enclosure - 
loadout.notes: This #casual #pve #void build has been slightly neutered since it was first created, but the goal is to make enemies volatile (from grenade, finisher, destabilizing rounds) and then finish one of them. The finisher causes a huge explosion, killing just about everything in a ~12m radius, and making anything that didn't die finishable. It's very strong when you can get it off.

loadout.name: Starfire - DPS
loadout.notes: Since Starfire's nerf, this #solar exotic has struggled for #dps, however this #pve build is supposed to bring that back. The build is built around getting very high uptime on grenades when in a well, and firing autoloading weapons when not throwing grenades. I have to test it in #endgame, but it looks promising

loadout.name: Verity's Brow - 
loadout.notes: This #solar build seems like it has potential in #endgame #pve

loadout.name:  - Fallen Sunstar - 
loadout.notes: A #casual #arc #pve build based around having constant ability uptime. Should be decent against #overload champions, and can blind #unstoppable champs if they have an enemy next to them that you can kill. Depending on how good elemental charge is, I could probably convert some of these decay mods to charge mods.

loadout.name: A Current GM Weapon Set - 
loadout.notes: Guns that are good for #endgame and gms based on the current champion mods

loadout.name: Point Contact Cannon Brace - 
loadout.notes: This #arc #pve build is way more fun than I was expecting. There's very little downtime on your melee as long as it's killing things, and it kills just about anything in #casual content. Even in #endgame #pve, it does pretty good, only struggling against things that don't stagger. A blinding gl helps somewhat.

loadout.name: Hoarfrost - 
loadout.notes: This exotic really boosts a #casual #stasis crystal build, but there isn't really a place for that right now. Maybe at some point with element charge, but I'm not really sure what to do with the charges once I have them, other than getting abilities back faster.

loadout.name: No Backup Plans - 
loadout.notes: I would imagine this is a #casual #pve build, since shotguns aren't meta in endgame at the moment, but the constant #void overshields might put it over the top. Legend of Acrius got a buff recently, so the 35% damage buff from overshields seems like it would just delete anything you shoot.

loadout.name: Sunbracers - 
loadout.notes:
Since scorch is linked to its source, any #solar ignition started by a melee will proc sunbracers (which is important since a melee will often not kill in #endgame #pve). Because of this, we can proc a #solar ignition using snap+phoenix dive while heat rises is active, which will 
 - Kill something and active sunbracers
 - Give restoration, which can be refreshed with solar kills
 - Generate melee energy from kills in air
A weapon with scorch (on damage, not on kill) might also help jumpstart the build when our abilities are on cooldown.

loadout.name:  - Dawn Chorus - 
loadout.notes: I'm not really sure what this #solar exotic's purpose is supposed to be in #pve post-lightfall. It gives better daybreak damage, but its only other benefit is increased melee regen, and I think sunbracers is probably better for that (in addition to everything sunbracers does) - maybe #endgame content where kills are harder to get.

loadout.name: Abeyant Leap - 
loadout.notes: This #endgame #pve build is probably the strongest titan build at the moment. With #strand, you can infinitely suspend targets, and abeyant leap lets you do it in a wider range. Additionally, woven mail is super easy to pickup and gives a crazy amount of damage resistance.

loadout.name: Rain of Fire - 
loadout.notes: This #solar build is amazing at dealing with #barrier champions, and chill-clip allows it to stun #overload and #unstoppable champions too. After getting a weapon kill, this build has incredibly high radiance uptime from weapon and ability kills. Firesprites give access to healing and armor charges without kills in #endgame #pve.

loadout.name: Phoenix Protocol - 
loadout.notes: A decent #solar #endgame #pve build focused on radiance and well uptime

loadout.name: Star Eater Scales - 
loadout.notes:
Fantastic super damage exotic that excels in team #pve. A #neutral exotic that works on almost any subclass: 
- With a bunch of #solar hunters, you can get almost infinite super. 
- Very good in #casual raids or dungeons on #arc since you won't typically need another exotic. 
- There aren't too many #strand exotics, so this acts as a nice buff to the super.

loadout.name:  - Shards of Galanor - 
loadout.notes: shards are probably better than celestial in #solar 3.0

loadout.name: Ahamkara's Spine - 
loadout.notes:
I believe this is the strongest #solar hunter build in #endgame #pve right now. Each grenade kill: 
- Gives health
- Creates an orb
- Gives super energy
- Gives melee energy (which can create an orb and gives super energy)
- Progresses gunpowder gamble
We can also stun #barrier champs with radiant and ignitions aren't difficult to make for #unstoppable champions.

loadout.name: Loreley Splendor - 
loadout.notes: The ability to get #solar restoration (as well as the other benefits of sunspots) on command is insane and this will continue to be an incredible build in #endgame #pve

loadout.name: Kepri's Horn - 
loadout.notes: This #strand build might be the only time Khepri's Horn will be viable, even in #casual #pve. Getting some immediate damage on suspended targets seems beneficial, and could probably act as a utility kick-start with Thread of Mind. It almost might be strong with #solar, giving an extra source of scorch.

loadout.name: HoIL Arc - 
loadout.notes: The damage output of #arc grenades in this build is insane. Both storm and pulse grenades do a ton of damage, and regenerate quickly. I could probably find a way to get some insane super regen out of this (something with dynamo + ashes to assest) but the grenade regeneration is probably more important anyway since crash isn't great in #endgame #pve without cuirass.

loadout.name: Aeons
loadout.notes: Created as #void, but could easily be made #neutral. Would probably work well with #stasis (use disc instead of res mods) or #solar.

loadout.name:  - Stormdancers - 
loadout.notes: #arc #casual #pve

loadout.name:  - Celestial Nighthawk - 
loadout.notes: since #solar 3.0, this exotic has been outclassed by calibans hand and ignition builds.

loadout.name: Osmiomancy - 
loadout.notes: This is a nasty #endgame #pve crowd control build that can deal with #overload and #unstoppable easily. With elemental charge, #stasis shards give almost unlimited armor charge and overshields, so making use of both of those will let this build see its full potential.

loadout.name: PvP Transversives
loadout.notes: #neutral #pvp

loadout.name: PvP Eye of Another World - 
loadout.notes: #neutral #pvp

loadout.name:  - Omnioculus - 
loadout.notes: #void, would be nice to have more mobility or recovery, but resilience is so good atm that it feels worth sacrificing almost any stat for it

loadout.name: Synthoceps - 
loadout.notes: this is a pretty #neutral build, but probably works best with #solar or #strand

loadout.name: Falling Star - 
loadout.notes: #arc

loadout.name: PvP Stag - 
loadout.notes: #neutral #pvp

loadout.name: Armamentarium - 
loadout.notes: #strand, #neutral

loadout.name: PvP Astrocyte - 
loadout.notes: #void #pvp

loadout.name: PvP Ophidian Aspects - 
loadout.notes: #neutral #pvp
serves as a barrier between active and inactive loadouts

loadout.name:  - Orpheus Rigs - 
loadout.notes: #void

loadout.name: PvP Solar Subclass - 
loadout.notes: #solar #pvp

annotation.notes: #solar #casual #pve, I think this can stun #unstoppable champions after 8 shots (2 explosions), but that's a long time
#endgame #pve. When on #solar, this can stun #unstoppable champions (or #barrier when radiant).
#neutral, #pve, this seems good with ranged melees as long as they can kill in #endgame
#arc, #casual #pve, test vintage timber w/ no orn
#solar, #endgame #pve, resilience is best stat atm, keep other in case something changes
#void, #casual #pve, if using void guns, it seems like verity's would be more effective since the timer nerf
#pvp, high recovery + high discipline, usually takes sister shader with ada armor, keep for iron banner bonus
#void, incredible for #solo content and for surviving in #endgame #pve
#neutral #solar, #raid #pve, bota with emp rift might be a better option post bubble nerf
#endgame/#casual #pve, if there's ever #barrier mg this thing will slap
high total, transmog with prestige leviathan helmet
#pvp, #endgame #pve, > #dps. aggressive will have better total damage IF it has tt+vorpal, CURRENT BEST FOR TOTAL DMG
#endgame #pve, #barrier/#overload for damage increase and reducing required shot count
#pvp, this gun has insane stats for a 120, and outlaw offsets the reload loss from iron grip
#pvp, might replace best in slot with snapshot change
#endgame/#casual #pve, really good for burst #dps, but not great for champions
#neutral, #raid #pve, could be good replacement after bubble nerf, but people have to not be in the rift
#neutral #pve. Probably the best hunter super #dps exotic on every subclass except solar
#solar #dps, #endgame #pve with the fragment that lets you heal on grenade kills
#endgame #pve, #barrier/#overload for damage increase and reducing required shot count
#neutral, #pvp, #pve, should probably trade this out for the other, but need to check loadout optimizer first
#endgame/#casual #pve, able to use explosive and damage buff for #overload rounds
#pvp, slide/opening shot w accurized maxes range at 7m. Handling has become increasingly important.
#pvp, killing wind gives a decent range and handling boost, but requires a kill to get there.
#pvp, if backup plan is good - qd is good pair
#casual #pve, could be useful against #overload but needs either a nearby kill or a super to stun them
#casual #pve, high intellect, lots of additional #solar scorch, but starfire is just so good. Have to come back to it
#pve, high recovery + high discipline, replace iron fellowship robes since this doesnt have an artifact slot now
#casual #pve, might be good in #endgame or for #dps since slideshot can reload quickly
#pvp, tunnel vision and kc pair well, but 3s is a long reload, QAS helps with slow handling. steady hand out stats this
The missiles do tons of damage, and since they also stun #unstoppable champs, this could be good in #endgame #pve
#endgame #pve, #overload, basically nation of beasts. Have to test for the feel of each, but rh probably wins
#endgame #pve, this thing is insane for burst damage
#pvp, wastelander's range caps out at 7m, so a range mw doesn't do much while both perks are active. craftable
#casual #pve, this is nuts with the #strand nectoric build
#endgame #pve, adaptive on a fusion sounds interesting since it might ramp quickly, but might not be needed post lf
#endgame/#casual #pve, probably not bad for #unstoppable since you can reset the stun cooldown and detonate enemies
high total, id:6917529760062212524 is better but I'm not sure it makes enought of a difference
#pve, high resilience + high intellect, should probably be replaced by id:"6917529857149013186"
#void #pve, seems viable for #endgame solo content with #overload
#endgame #pve, afa is incredible. can also roll with adaptive and rapid hit as alternative for matchgame. needs reload
#casual #pve, #solar or #strand with weavewalker. Could be useful for stunning #barrier champions in #endgame
high resilience + high intellect, if intellect becomes useful the stat total is insane
#casual #pve, only #endgame in activities that have high enemy density since the healing + trait both help survivability
high resilience + high discipline, id:6917529804444665193 is better, but this has an artifice slot
#endgame #casual #pve, this #neutral exotic is incredible for getting abilities back.
#endgame #pve, great for gms and champions bc of alh, but needs a way to get orbs without dying
This could be amazing in #pvp with revives, but I think the cooldown makes this less viable in #pve
#pve, while this doesnt have a damage perk, it has cc and fp, which allow for higher #dps at the cost of total damage
#endgame #pve #dps, it should be easy to get explosive light to max stacks with lightfall's increase to orb gen
#pvp, rangefinder is keeping this around, bringing the range just over 18m
#pve, #endgame - alh since cc should activate on every round. #casual - unrelenting on crystal detonation
#pvp, not sure how good desperado is on a 390, but it would be worth checking out
high recovery + high discipline, replace id:6917529200982161158
#raid, high recovery + high discipline, replace iron fellowship robes
#casual #pve, I think joltshot does enough to be #endgame even without an #arc subclass.
#endgame #pve, good for #barrier since you can burn through shields and get a free damage buff
high recovery + high discipline. replace id:6917529202874956490
#casual #pve, wouldn't normally keep, but this has great origin traits and it's stasis
#casual #pve, this thing is an ability regenning machine
#endgame #pve, #barrier, I think I should switch to fluted barrel since I've hit max recoil direction
#endgame #pve #dps, this is nearly identical to the wendigo I have, but might be good to keep for solar surges
#casual/#endgame #pve, requires level 4 (10), might be a fun weapon I actually craft multiple of
#endgame/#casual #pve. This thing is a monster. 144 in the mag and a near constant 15% damage buff is incredible.
#casual #pve, S19 glaive is significantly better, but this has a faster rpm so maybe having both would be good
#endgame #pve, could be good for #dps with field prep and spike or ad clear with blinding
#endgame #pve, need to test the damage of the double body shot perks, but it might be a constant 20% damage buff
#void #endgame #pve, this might be useful with the S21 buff, allowing void to stun #barrier, but it's niche
#casual #pve, idk maybe kinetic tremors on a sidearm will be good
#neutral, #pvp, #endgame #pve, interacts well with #stasis and #strand and surpasses ability cooldown caps
THE WORST GUN I HAVE EVER USED
#endgame #pve, keep this to try kill clip with kinetic tremors
#endgame #pve #dps, if bipod gets a buff (which it probably will because it's awful) this will be great
#stasis, could be good in #endgame #pve if stasis gets a buff
#casual #pve, first kinetic wave frame, but has an awful first column perk. ca is good with stasis shards
Technically #neutral, but volatile on #void explosions makes this a good choice for #casual #pve
#casual #pve, Collective action has a huge uptime on #stasis
#endgame/#casual #pve, #arc. Joltshot almost acts as kill-clip for stunning #overload champions
#neutral #pve, probably best for a subclass that has less intrinsic healing, #mw
#casual #pve, controlled burst seems very strong for #dps
#endgame #pve, craft with rr & tremors, I just don't think 150s feel good
could be #endgame #pve, but I'm not sure I like how the gun even feels. push range
#endgame #pve, this might be the best #dps  weapon in the game
#casual #pve, might #replace calus's mini tool bc of demo
An interesting exotic, but I feel like its only use would be in #pvp, or #pve on #void (support) or #strand (suspend)
a #neutral exotic that only has room in #pve on a #strand subclass
#neutral #casual #pve, this exotic is so fun with the hive boomer
#endgame #pve #dps, if bipod gets a buff (which it probably will because it's awful) this will be great

search.query: (is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and is:primary and #pve
(is:weapon or is:armor) -is:sunset -tag:archive -tag:infuse -tag:junk (is:void or is:strand or is:kinetic)
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and (is:void or is:strand or is:kinetic) and #pve
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and (is:void or is:strand or is:kinetic) and #pve and (is:autorifle or is:special)
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and (is:void or is:strand or is:kinetic) and #pve and (is:autorifle or is:special or is:heavy)
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and #overload
(is:weapon or is:armor) -is:sunset -tag:archive -tag:infuse -tag:junk (is:crafted or source:ritual-weapon or is:exotic)
(stat:resilience:>28 or stat:recovery:>28 or stat:mobility:>28) (stat:discipline:>28 or stat:strength:>23 or stat:intellect:>28)
(stat:resilience:>28 or stat:recovery:>28) (stat:discipline:>28 or stat:strength:>23 or stat:intellect:>28)
(stat:resilience:>27 or stat:recovery:>27 or stat:mobility:>27) (stat:discipline:>27 or stat:strength:>27 or stat:intellect:>27)
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and #mw
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and -is:masterwork and #mw
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and mementonon
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and power:1600 and is:legendary and #pve
(is:weapon or is:armor) and -is:sunset and -tag:archive and -tag:infuse and -tag:junk and #pve
high and mobility and + and high and intellect
